Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed (fired red) below; part of lotus flower in faded added white outline and added red centre; traces of other floral motifs; top of rim glazed; exterior: diagonal stroke band between pairs of dilute lines, reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number '927' is written in pencil on the interior surface. Type B kantharoi typically have painted inscription beneath the rim. They do not however, have rim patterns. The rim pattern on this sherd is consistent with some Chalice Style chalices. See Oxford AN1888.217 [h]. Chalice Style chalices at Naukratis do not typically have painted inscriptions.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 169, no. 200)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 732, no. 920)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0967) (phase 2)
